questions.question: What was the main purpose of the reservation system?

choices.answer: To make the new transcontinental railroad safer to operate
To provide unemployment for Union troops and Civil War veterans
To clear federal lands for settlement by railroads, ranchers, and farmers
To make it easier for Indians to assimilate into American culture

questions.question: What was the impact of the Dawes Act on the Native American experience?

choices.answer: It enabled Native Americans to sell their land
It led to armed conflict between settlers and Indian warriors
It helped to preserve Native American traditions
It forced Native American tribes to move onto government reservations

questions.question: How did the Kansas-Nebraska Act contribute to the outbreak of the Civil War?

choices.answer: It allowed enslaved persons in Kansas to buy their freedom
It freed all slaves in Kansas and Nebraska causing southern resentment
It encouraged abolitionists by halting the spread of slavery into Kansas
It reopened the question of if slavery was allowed in Northern territories

questions.question: Which best completed the diagram?

choices.answer: prohibited slavery in Kansas
Overturned the Missouri Compromise
Opposed by Senator Stephen Douglas
Supported the New Republican party

questions.question: What was the implication of the Supreme Courtâ€™s decision in Dred Scott v. Sanford?

choices.answer: Congress could do nothing about slavery in the territories.
The Kansas-Nebraska Act was declared unconstitutional.
Slaves who escaped to a free state were legally free.
Slaves could no longer be considered property.

questions.question: Which of the choices below best describes the reconstruction plan of President Andrew Johnson?

choices.answer: 10% of Southern states pledge loyalty for the state to be restored to union
Exclude Confederate officers & landowners, & pardon thousands of troops
Create Freedmen's Bureau to assist Southern landowners
ratify 14th and 15th amendment and pass Civil Rights Act of 1866

questions.question: What view of Reconstruction is shown through this cartoon?

choices.answer: Southerners welcomed assistance from the North
Northern politicians provided goods to Southerners
Northerners exploited the economy of the South
Northern troops destroyed the stability of the South

questions.question: How did the cotton gin impact Southern economy?

choices.answer: Sped the process of cotton production increasing factories in the South
Required farmers to hire more workers to keep up with the demand for cotton
Allowed landowners to free more slaves since they were not needed
Sped the process of cotton production creating a dependency on slave labor

questions.question: What was a major accomplishment of Radical Republicans during Reconstruction?

choices.answer: Former slaves were paid for their years of free labor
Civil Rights legislation was passed to protect African Americans
The Southern economy was saved and factory production increased
The power of the President was greatly expanded

questions.question: Neither slavery nor involuntary servitude...shall exist within the United States...

choices.answer: 13th amendment
14th amendment
15th amendment
19th amendment

questions.question: All people born or naturalized in the US are citizens; citizens get due process of law and equal protection of the law

choices.answer: 13th amendment
14th amendment
15th amendment
19th amendment

questions.question: Suffrage cannot be denied based on race, color, or previous condition of servitude

choices.answer: 13th amendment
14th amendment
15th amendment
19th amendment

questions.question: Why was Andrew Johnson impeached?

choices.answer: He continued to veto Civil Rights legislation
He would not agree to end slavery
He would not agree to the readmission of Southern states back to the Union
His Reconstruction plan was too strict

questions.question: Which issue divided Republicans during the early Reconstruction era?

choices.answer: whether slavery should be abolished
how much to raise tariffs on manufactured goods from abroad
whether to allow the circulation of Confederate money
what conditions to impose on Southern States for readmission into the Union

questions.question: Which constitutional issue was raised during Reconstruction?

choices.answer: Do states have the right to secede from the Union?
Do state governments have the power to deny former slaves citizenship?
Can the system of slavery be extended into the Northwest?
Do former slaves have the right to file a lawsuit in federal court?

questions.question: What was the impact of the decision in Plessy vs. Ferguson?

choices.answer: Jim Crow laws remained in the South for another half century.
State governments had to ensure the equality of all individuals
Southern state governments were forced to end racial segregation
States no longer had to provide equal facilities to different races

questions.question: Which sentence describes a consequence of the end of Reconstruction?

choices.answer: The Southern economy prospered
African Americans freely exercised equal rights
Federal troops didn't enforce civil rights laws leading to the nadir
Southern Democrats were upset that Reconstruction had ended

questions.question: Which best describes the Homestead Act and the Morrill Act?

choices.answer: Ways to stop monopolies during The Gilded Age
Ways the federal government dealt with Native Americans
Encouraged Westward Expansion with land for homes and colleges
Methods of readmitting Southern states back into the Union

questions.question: Which political party demanded bimetallism - the use of Gold and Silver Standards for printing money?

choices.answer: The Republican Party
The Populist Party
The Democratic Party
The Socialist Party

questions.question: Which option describes characteristics of the First Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: Machinery, Steel Production, and Expansion of Railroads
Steam, Textile Production, and the beginning of the Factory system
Oil, England, the use of Electricity

questions.question: Which option describes characteristics of the Second Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: Machinery, Steel Production, and the expansion of Railroads
Steam, Textile Production, and the beginning of the Factory system
Oil, England, hand-made goods, and the use of Electricity

questions.question: One large company owns: Lifeline Oil - East Coast Oil - Coastal Oil

choices.answer: Horizontal Integration
Vertical Integration

questions.question: Owning all stages of manufacturing from the ground up...

choices.answer: Horizontal Integration
Vertical Integration

questions.question: Nativists were against immigration

choices.answer: False
True

questions.question: European immigrants found it harder to assimilate than Asian immigrants

choices.answer: False
True
